title: "d3dx9_39.dll is missing"
body:
I just wiped my computer clean, installed league and when the game started I get the "d3dx9_39.dll is missing" error.

First of all how do I fix this without reinstalling?

I am now on my second 5 minute low priority crap, but I'm trying to find a solution to this problem..... being banned doesn't seem right to me

replies.body:
That sounds like a pain to get put into low priority queue due to technical issues. If you've just reformatted your computer and installed League of Legends, it's possible that you don't have the correct video drivers. Can you check out our Game Crashes KB article here:

- https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes#wq2

- https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes#wq3

If video drivers aren't installed or DirectX is missing, your system wouldn't be able to utilize the correct hardware to run when playing PC games. In such cases, when the game attempts to start, it crashes out because an appropriate graphics card cannot be found. If you've already installed the latest drivers or cannot find the appropriate drivers, feel free to contact us on the [Support Site](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/requests/new) and my colleagues will be happy to help you.

It's happening continually, is there some way you can stop banning me for testing solutions to the problem? I'm sick of waiting 5 minutes just to get queued and booted because the solution you suggested has not worked and yes I'll report this to your support site, but it's pretty frustrating getting banned because a solution has not worked

Heya
If you test it in customgames the leaverbuster wont punish you.

Regards Rkoturdo

THANK YOU!!! FINALLY SOME REAL HELP INVOLVING BANS

Can anyone else give me some information on this error? The direct x and driver updates aren't working. Is there a way to fix the problem with that specific file?

replies.poster: Q r a f T e e
replies.body: If you're still having problems, I think you're supposed to write in a ticket.

You can actually just stuff d3dx9_39.dll into the folder containing "League of Legends.exe".
Unfortunately, this directory changes occasionally with version (currently version 0.0.1.165 on mine).
Find where you installed LoL and you can put it in as ...\RADS\solutions\lol_game_client_sln\releases\0.0.1.165\deploy\d3dx9_39.dll

You can get d3dx9_39.dll by googling for "d3dx9_39.dll download".
Do you have any links to the one that you downloaded from... because a lot them seem very shady and I don't want to risk anything...
